TITLE: Command-line Options for Create Better-T-Stack CLI
DESCRIPTION: Complete list of available command-line options for configuring projects including database types, ORM selection, frontend frameworks, and various other features and addons.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amanvarshney01/create-better-t-stack/blob/main/apps/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: create-better-t-stack [project-directory] [options]

Options:
  -V, --version                   Output the version number
  -y, --yes                       Use default configuration
  --database <type>               Database type (none, sqlite, postgres, mysql, mongodb)
  --orm <type>                    ORM type (none, drizzle, prisma)
  --auth                          Include authentication
  --no-auth                       Exclude authentication
  --frontend <types...>           Frontend types (tanstack-router, react-router, tanstack-start, native, none)
  --addons <types...>             Additional addons (pwa, tauri, starlight, biome, husky, none)
  --examples <types...>           Examples to include (todo, ai, none)
  --git                           Initialize git repository
  --no-git                        Skip git initialization
  --package-manager <pm>          Package manager (npm, pnpm, bun)
  --install                       Install dependencies
  --no-install                    Skip installing dependencies
  --db-setup <setup>              Database setup (turso, prisma-postgres, mongodb-atlas, none)
  --backend <framework>           Backend framework (hono, express, elysia)
  --runtime <runtime>             Runtime (bun, node)
  -h, --help                      Display help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Better-T-Stack CLI Using Package Managers
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Better-T-Stack using different package managers including npm, bun, and pnpm. Each command initiates the CLI wizard for project scaffolding.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amanvarshney01/create-better-t-stack/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Using npm
npx create-better-t-stack@latest

# Using bun
bun create better-t-stack@latest

# Using pnpm
pnpm create better-t-stack@latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Create Better-T-Stack CLI using Package Managers
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the CLI tool without installing it globally using different package managers including npm, bun, and pnpm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amanvarshney01/create-better-t-stack/blob/main/apps/cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Using npm
npx create-better-t-stack@latest

# Using bun
bun create better-t-stack@latest

# Using pnpm

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Development Setup Commands for Better-T-Stack
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up the development environment, including cloning the repository, installing dependencies, and starting development servers for both CLI and web components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amanvarshney01/create-better-t-stack/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/better-t-stack/create-better-t-stack.git

# Install dependencies
bun install

# Start CLI development
bun dev:cli

# Start website development
bun dev:web
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Running Development Server with Package Managers
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing dependencies and starting the development server using npm, pnpm, or bun package managers. Shows multiple ways to achieve the same setup tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amanvarshney01/create-better-t-stack/blob/main/apps/web/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Install dependencies
npm install
# or
pnpm install
# or
bun install

# Start development server
npm run dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

TITLE: Example Usage with Custom Database and ORM Options
DESCRIPTION: Command example demonstrating how to create a project with specific database, ORM, and addon configurations.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Creating Cards Component in JSX
DESCRIPTION: A JSX component that displays a set of card links to documentation resources. The component includes two cards with links to Next.js and Fumadocs documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amanvarshney01/create-better-t-stack/blob/main/apps/web/content/docs/index.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<Cards>
  <Card title="Learn more about Next.js" href="https://nextjs.org/docs" />
  <Card title="Learn more about Fumadocs" href="https://fumadocs.vercel.app" />
</Cards>
```

LANGUAGE: robotstxt

```
Disallow:
```
